intro: Pavetta klotzschiana var. incana, commonly known as the woolly pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The leaves are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive, fluffy appearance.
